title: TPACK-Based Technology-Integrated LanguageÂ·Content Development Intensive Course for Science Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of secondary science curriculum content knowledge, fundamental digital tool usage, and scientific terminology and explanatory text organization (grammar structure, vocabulary level)
context.additional_context: Strengthening TPACK model application capabilities in smartphone-based blended learning environments for corporate science educators. Focuses on enhancing linguistic clarity of scientific concepts (precise terminology, concise sentence structures) and learner comprehension (reading ability improvement, expression clarification).

learning_goals: When designing science lessons, learners integrate technology, content, and language expression (grammar, vocabulary, text structure) using the seven knowledge domains of the TPACK framework.

Learners develop at least three learning management, assessment, and communication strategies using smartphone-based tools (Canva, Quizlet, etc.), including optimization plans for scientific terminology and text expressions (readability enhancement, expressive power strengthening).

Learners create a digital literacy self-assessment checklist and establish plans that consider clarity of scientific concept explanations (logical organization) and linguistic accessibility (learner-friendly expressions) when applying technology-integrated lesson plans.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
